page.title: 02LANDSCAPE
page.content: The area that we have had to study is mainly given over to farming.The river Windrush crosses the area from west to east and this has had an effect on the ariculture of the area. Around the banks of the river the fields are given over to the growing of grass which, in turn is kept for the grazing of cattle. Some of the grass is kept for silage or hay. Further away from the river the fields are given over to arable crops. The most popular seems to be barley and oil seed rape. In our area the main centre of population is in the village of Minster Lovell.
